Ans .The pearl river
Q.19 What is continental shelf?
Ans . It is a region at the edge of a continent extending from the shore line to the first steeping of the continental slope.
Q.20 What is Continental rise?
Ans . It is the gently sloping region that lies on the seaward side of the continental slope and extends down to the Abyssal plain.
Q.21 What is continental divide?
Ans . It is the high region of a continent which separate streams flowing to opposite sides of the continent and ultimately, in some cases, into separate oceans.
Q.22 Who published the Theory of continental Drift?
Ans . German meterologist Alfred Wegener in 1915.
Q.23 What divides Asia from North America?
Ans . Berring Strait.
Q.24 Which is the longest river in Asia?
Ans . The Yangtze (4345 km) in China
Q.25 Which is the second largest country in terms of population?
Ans . India
Q.26 Worlds most destructive earthquake occurred in which country?.
Ans . Japan in 1923
Q.27 Which country is the third largest producer of electric energy?
Ans . japan
Q.28 Where is the worlds largest Sea port?
Ans .Singapore
Q.29 What is erosion?.
Ans . Gradual wearing away of portions of earths surface by rain, snow and wind
Q.30 What is horizon?
Ans . The circular line where the sky and the earth or sea appear to meet.
Q.31 What is the difference between Isobars and Isotherms?
Ans . Isobars are lines on a map joining those places whch have the same barometric pressure. Isothrms are lines on a map joining those places which have the same mean temperature.
Q.32 What is a Continent?.
Ans . A Continent is a major land mass including both the region of dry land abovve sea level and the continental shelf. 29% of the surface of the Earth is made up of continents
